item.title: Medicare Prescription Drug Low-Income Assistance Act of 2004

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.

item.title: Medicare Assurance of Rx Transitional Assistance Act of 2004

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance. (text of measure as introduced: CR S5375)

item.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 656.
Introduced in the Senate. Read the first time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under Read the First Time. (text of measure as introduced: CR S8481)
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S8479-8480)

summary.text: Medicare Assurance of Rx Transitional Assistance Act of 2004 - Amends title XVIII (Medicare) of the Social Security Act (SSA) to provide for the automatic enrollment of Medicare Savings Program (MSP) beneficiaries under SSA title XIX (Medicaid) in the interim prescription drug discount program and the transitional assistance program, making them eligible for the $600 per year in low-income discount card assistance without requiring a separate enrollment process.

bill.title: Medicare Assurance of Rx Transitional Assistance Act of 2004

item.title: Medicare Assurance of Rx Transitional Assistance Act of 2004
Medicare Assurance of Rx Transitional Assistance Act of 2004

A bill to amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to provide for the automatic enrollment of medicaid beneficiaries for prescription drug benefits under part D of such title, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 656.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
